page.title: 07COPPLESTONE STATION
page.content: The railway line from Crediton to Barnstaple was the subject of a long struggle for ownership between 1846 and 1852. Eventually the South Western Railway and the Taw Vale Companies joined to construct the North Devon Railway, and work on the line was begun at Copplestone on 2nd February, 1852. The first Station master was William Leyman. In the 1960s one of the two lines was taken up, and the signal box was demolished. The station buildings have been sold as a house, and the station is now unmanned. Trains stop at the station two times a day in each direction but other trains stop by request. There has been some talk of closing the line because it operates at a loss, but so far it remains open.
